item.title: Plague
item.description:
Plague alchemists use their mastery over toxic substances to melt their enemies. They have incredible damage potential in drawn out fights without healers.You gain the Elemental Adept feat, applied to poison damage. Whenever a creature fails a saving throw against one of your spells that deals damage, or on-hit, it applies a stack of Toxic. For the 1 minute, they take poison damage equal to the stacks of toxic they have at the start of each of their turns. Toxic damage can apply toxic stacks, but it does not extend its duration.Toxic damage cannot kill creatures, only defeating them if it drops them to 0. The toxic stacks persist while defeated, but do not accumulate further.
This can be removed with Provide First Aid or by washing a creature clean, such as by being submerged in water. Any effect that removes venom can also remove toxic stacks.
Whenever you use alchemical inspiration to create a toxin, you can apply it to a held weapon and make an attack with it as a free action.Whenever a creature fails a save against one of your toxins, they also gain a stack of toxic.As a standard action, remove all toxic stacks from all creatures within 60 ft of you. Creatures take 3 true damage for each stack of toxic they possesses.
You can choose to either make it deadly or nonlethal. Nonlethal expunges can only defeat creatures, not kill them. Lethal expunges give creatures Disadvantage on luck checks to not Die.
When done out of combat, this ability has the Subtle tag.
When you successfully Hide from a creature and attack them or cast a spell on them, you can make an additional simple attack against them as a swift action.When you are defeated, you can expunge as an immediate action.

item.title: Defeat
item.description:
When you take damage that reduces you to zero hp, you are defeated, and must be healed to regain consciousness in a timely manner.You can choose to non-lethally defeat someone provided you are using a manufactured weapon, unarmed strike or natural attack. If this is not the case, they must make a DC 8 luck check or die. Creatures that manage to survive being defeated have to keep making this luck check every time they take damage while defeated.
When a character recovers from the defeated condition, they are dazed on their next turn.
When recovering from the defeated condition, you also gain an Affliction.
When a main character (ie usually the players) falls to zero HP, they are not at risk of instant death. Instead of rolling luck checks, a main character gets a stack of doom when they take damage while defeated. Upon acquiring the 5th stack, they die. Doom stacks are lost on rest.
See Recovering from Defeat.

item.title: Potion Man
item.description:
Potion man, sitting at your stand trying to expand, but they taste so bland. You are a master of using potions to aid you allies. You can bottle your own techniques into potions to share them with allies.You can spend a point of alchemical inspiration to bottle your knowledge. Choose a single technique you possess with the buff or Prepared tags. You can give an ally access to this technique as though using the Administer Potion action.If it is a prepared technique, it lasts for 10 minutes. If it is a buff, it lasts its usual duration. Effects that are normally only target "self" are usable on others through extracts.
Health potions you create using alchemical inspiration heal an additional 3 hp. You can throw a healing potion at an ally or a spot on the ground to have its healing juices wash over them, affecting a 5 ft radius around its impact zone.
Mana potions also share this explosive quality, but restore no additional mana.Extracts you create with the prepared tag now last until rest. Your ally no longer needs to take a immediate action to consume the extracts.

item.title: Swashbuckler
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Swashbuckler are the best duelists around, with their signature parry and riposte ability giving them an edge over virtually all martial combatants, especially in melee. Their swift action is incredibly valuable, and can be spent in a number of ways that are powerful in their own ways.Gain a pool of 5 points (called panache) to use your class features with that replenishes when you roll initiative, or when you take certain actions in combat. Regain panache when you perform the following actions.
Succeed on a gambit (5)
Willingly provoke an AoO from a non Minion enemy with your actions (1) Roll at least 10 higher than an enemy's AC and crit a non minion enemy (1) Defeat a non minion enemy (1) With a light weapon in your main hand and a buckler in your offhand, you can parry at any time. If you choose to use an unarmed strike or natural attack, you need a buckler in your off hand and a completely free main hand. Parry functions in 2 different ways.Prepare to Parry - You can choose to forgo any number of attacks during your turn. Until the start of your next turn you can parry as an instant action a number of times equal to the number of attacks you decided to forego. If you successfully negate an attack, you can riposte and make a melee attack against the creature as an instant action.Reactive Parry - You can attempt to parry an attack without preparing by spending 2 panache. If you successfully negate an attack, you can riposte make a melee attack against the creature as an immediate action.If your foe attacked with a ranged attack, or with a weapon that has the reach property, you can only retaliate if they are within your reach. You can parry without a buckler, but take a -4 penalty to attack when you parry.When wearing light or no armor, and wielding a single light weapon, get the following benefits. +3 bonus to AC
(4+½ Lv) bonus damage with light weapons +5 speed You get a +4 bonus on bluff checks to feint, and an equal bonus on insight checks to resist feint. You can feint as a swift action. By spending 1 panache as a free action, you gain advantage.
You can innately cast It's Time to Duel.You speak the language pirates. While not a secret language, it is incredibly difficult to understand despite it only being a modified version of common. A creature must be trained in linguistics to see past the many layers of slang that typify pirate lingo.The first time you use luck to add to a d20 roll each round, it doesn't take an action. By spending 1 panache, you can reroll a save as an immediate action.
When you are hit or grazed by an attack, spend 1 panache as an immediate action to gain a +4 bonus to AC against a that attack and move 5 ft.
As a standard action, automatically feint a creature. It is feinted for all allies as well until the end of your next turn. A creature you use superior feint against becomes immune to it for 1 minute.
You can take the focus action as a swift action. While you focus, you get a +4 bonus to... AoOs made against this creature Reflex saves against the creature's acrobatics Perception against this creature
By spending 1 panache, choose a specific body part to target to gain a bonus effect On-hit (fort negates). Special: This special attack can be used more than once a combat by spending more panache.Reactive parry requires only 1 panache. When you riposte after a reactive parry, it is an instant action instead of an immediate action.

item.title: Standard Fighter
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Rally your allies around a point and fight together. Your standard is an annoying attack that you can to enhance allies on the battlefield. All of your class features are centered around rallying around and the manipulation of this standard.
As a swift action, summon a flag from the sky and have it slam down onto an unoccupied space within 30 ft of you. Enemies within 5 ft of it take (1+Lv) Force damage. You can choose to automatically pick up your flag by moving into its space, recharging this ability. A creature can knock over your flag by rolling athletics as a swift action (DC 10+your athletics bonus), causing it to disappear and recharging this ability. The flag automatically disappears after 1 minute.
While within 30 ft of your flag, your allies share your Teamwork Feats. Your flag counts as an ally to you for the purposes of fulfilling teamwork feat conditions.Gain a teamwork feat at lvl 1, 4 and 8.You speak the language of flag twirling. When communicating, you do it letter by letter, limiting its use to simple messages unless you spend a very long time.Your flag bears the mark of a country, guild or religion of significance. Members of the countries army or officials of the country, important members of your religion or guild etc. intuitively understand your messages.Before you make any attacks on your turn, you can decide to forfeit the ability to make combat maneuvers until the start of your next turn. When you do so, attacks deal poise damage equal to the hp damage they deal until the start of your next turn.
Once per round in place of an attack, you can slap some sense into a creature suffering from a Mind-Affecting effect. They take 1 True Damage and get an additional save against an effect of your choosing. If the effect had no DC, use the creature/entities offense trait DC/class DC.Make a charge attack targeting your flag from any distance, as long as you can see it and there is a direct path. Any creature in your path is automatically pushed out of your way on either side of you (your choice). You can melee attack any creature within reach once during this charge. You can choose to superior attack during the charge as well, allowing you to strike one particular creature twice.
You can use the aid action as a swift action. If your flag is within your natural reach when you use this feature, you use the aid action to give the same bonus to all creatures in your flag's aura.If you summon your flag and a creature is defeated by it, you can summon it again at a new location as a free action. Usable 1/turn.
When you summon your flag, and at the start of each of your turns, choose an ally to grant a divine shield. Can only happen 1/turn, regardless how many times you summon your flag.When you summon your flag, you can choose to activate this ability or not for its duration.The outer radius of your flags aura has a visible barrier around it. Creatures can pass through it freely, but attacks, spells, offense traits, thrown objects, weather effects and plenty of other things cannot. Any AoE effects are halted along the barriers edge. Even persistent ones like darkness or wall of fire are cut off. Whichever side of the barrier had more of the effect or it center is where it persists.
In general, creatures on opposite sides of the barrier have line of sight, but do not have Line of Effect of effect.

item.title: Kazekenshin
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Wind Swordsman are focused on being annoying and slippery with an incredibly powerful signature attack: Steel Tempest. Their abilities are centered around mobility to get into a better position to use this attack.Once per round when you land a melee attack against a creature, gain a stack of gathering storm. With two stacks of gathering storm, you can use this special attack. This special attack can be used any number of times in a combat.
Your attack whips up a whirlwind, targeting all enemies in a 60 ft line. Compare your attack roll to the ac of all creatures in the line. Enemies are Staggered On-hit for one round and take an additional d6/odd lvl damage.You cannot gain gathering storm stacks in the same turn you use steel tempest.
Keep a running tally of how far you move. Every time you move 60 ft, you gain a protective barrier that gives you DRA (3+1/2xLv) for the next instance of damage you take.Once per enemy per round, unless your speed is 0 or you are unable to make attacks, you can choose to dash in a straight line through a enemy within reach as a free action, appearing directly on the opposite side of the creature adjacent to them. This movement doesn't count against your movement each round. Any movement around a creature you target with this ability is also elusive for this turn.You can combine sweeping blade with steel tempest, creating a new unique effect. You can either attack a 60 ft line as usual, or you can choose to attack a 10 ft radius around you at your destination.
You can innately cast Wind Wall. You can use wind wall as an immediate action, but its size is decreased to a 15x15 square, its duration changes to 1 round and its range decreases to reach. It does not impede you or your allies' movement or attacks.
The penalty to ranged attacks also applies to the DC of any ability that must physically pass through the wall. It would not apply to a spell like charming gaze, but it would apply to an effect like bestial claw.You can only use this ability again after 1 minute passes.You can use sweeping blade against a single target you attack with steel tempest, appearing on the opposite side of them from your current position.As an immediate action, you can teleport adjacent to any creature you can see within 30 feet that gets inflicted with a debilitating status effect (such stagger, poisoned, sickened) and make a simple attack against them. This ability must be used in response to the status being inflicted, it cannot be used against a creature that merely happened to be status'd.Creatures hit by steel tempest are dazed for one round (fort reduces to stagger).Steel tempest's line attack increases in width. Instead of a 60 ft line that is 5 ft wide, it is 15 ft wide, essentially targeting all spaces adjacent to the line.When combined with sweeping blade, the AoE increases to a 20 ft radius around you at your destination.

item.title: Dark Knight
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Stand stalwart in the face of danger, an immovable obstacle that your opponents must fight tooth and nail to merely walk past, let alone survive. Outside of combat your massive skill bonuses can allow you to sense what others don't, and sniff out liars.Based on the Maplestory class of the same name.You can manifest an ominous looking eye that floats around you, enhancing your senses and giving you a palpable aura of menace. You get proficiency in intimidation and insight. You get a (4+½ lvl) bonus to perception, insight and intimidation. You also add this bonus to the DC to intimidate you.You can choose to make this eye disappear 1/turn as a free action, but you lose the bonuses to perception and intimidation.
All effects that grant elusive movement do not function against you while you wield a reach weapon, allowing you to make AoOs against a much larger number of creatures.If a creature tries to move around you safely using acrobatics while you wield a reach weapon, you add a bonus to your reflex save equal to the perception bonus granted by evil eye.
You get a +4 bonus to Fortitude saves. Your starting HP increases by 10. Each level after you gain an addition 4 hp.You take half damage from fortitude saves. When you pass a fort save, it deals no damage and has no additional effect.
You can make an infinite number of AoOs, and you have a +4 to ACC with AoOs.
When a creature ends its turn within your reach, it becomes shaken 1 (Will negates). Minions are automatically shaken.
You can leave behind a phantom weapon inside of your target on-hit. The creature is is unable to leave your natural reach and is Anchored. This condition only ends if you are disarmed, dazed, stunned, you or the target are moved out of reach or you are defeated.You can use this special attack an infinite number of times, but if you impale a second creature, the first is freed.
As a standard action, you can inspire all allies that can see you, giving them (10+4xLv of creature) additional current and maximum hp until they rest, or until you are defeated.

item.title: Summoning Sickness
item.description: Creature is drained 2 and cannot be summoned again until they are no longer drained.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Summoning Sickness.md

item.title: Bloody Finger
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Suddenly end fights with the power cause creatures to explode into bloody chunks long after you cut them with your blade. Gank people from across the realm who dare intrude upon your territory.
by Kero
Any piercing or slashing weapon you wield gains the bleed property. On-hit with a bleed weapon (even if it does no damage), keep a running tally of how many times the creature was hit. This number is referred to as "bleed stacks" and is separate from other bleed effects. Crits apply 2 bleed stacks. Bleed stacks are visible on the creatures body and last until you rest.Even if a creature cannot bleed, it can still gain bleed stacks.
Sheathe your weapon(s) as a standard action. Creatures that have bleed stacks (no matter the distance) lose all stacks and take 2d6 (7) True Damage. Creatures with 5+ stacks take 8d6 (28) true damage. Creatures with 10+ stacks take 16d6 (56) damage. This damage continues to double every 5 stacks infinitely.One of the bloody finger's fingers is always a crimson red. It can be used to write in a bloody ink.You can dual wield one handed weapons using dex or strength as long as the weapon has a Japanese name. If you wield a Japanese weapon in two hands, it applies 2 bleed stacks on hit, or 4 on a crit.This attack deals 0 apparent damage. Roll damage anyway and take note of it. The next time you use hemorrhage, any creature you struck with delayed doom takes all of this stored damage.You can use this special attack at will.
You can inscribe your name, or a symbol of significance to you on a surface using your bloodied finger. When a creature triggers the sigil, you get a glimpse of the surrounding area briefly. Anytime it is triggered, you can choose to crawl out of the sigil as though you were summoning yourself, causing the sigil to disappear. You can stay summoned this way for 5 minutes before you return to your body.
You cannot use this feature while you have summoning sickness. If you create a sigil while you already have one, the old one disappears.As a standard action, slash the air rapidly, causing many bloody projectiles to fly out in a 30 ft cone in front of you. Creatures in the area take 6d6 (21) slash or pierce damage and get 4 bleed stacks (reflex halves damage and bleed stacks).This ability recharges when you use your hemorrhage ability against a creature with 5 or more bleed stacks.
Gain scent (120 ft) and seeking against wounded creatures. Whenever a creature takes bleed damage within 30 ft of you, they gain a bleed stack.

item.title: Aran
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Cleave through waves of enemies eventually gaining the strength to spin through entire armies. Aran is the premier AoE DPS martial. Spin to win!
Gain weapon focus (slash) as a bonus feat. You can use great cleave at will. When you cleave, it is referred to as Smash Swing.If you defeat at least one enemy during Smash Swing, you may activate Combat Step as a swift action to move an additional 10 feet without spending your movement.Cleave normally requires you stand still to attack all foes in range, but movement using combat step ignores this, allowing you to continue your cleave as you step through combat. You still can't continue the endless cleave with your normal movement.At level 6, Combat Step is always a free action.After defeating an enemy with a melee attack, you get another Superior Attack that must be used before the end of your turn (doesn't work off-turn).Whenever you defeat another creature past the first in a round, get you an additional Combat Step that can be used as a free action.
Your melee attacks ignore damage resistance to single target attacks from group type enemies.
Your cleave attacks against group enemies always Crit on hit.Defeating an enemy heals 3 hp.
If you Smash Swing while in the air, you may spend all of your remaining movement to Fly in place until the start of your next turn. You may use this to fly using your Combat Steps, should you defeat enemies in the air. You cannot be made clumsy while using aero swing.You push your combat prowess to its absolute maximum in the heat of a combo. Superior Attacks deal maximum damage to opponents you struck with Smash Swing on the same turn.

item.title: Fighter
item.description:
Men-at-arms clad in steel that use various fighting styles to achieve the same goal: destroy as many enemies as possible using overwhelming martial prowess.
Deadly Arsenal, HearthstoneYou have martial specialization.
You gain 1 Technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used on any martial tree.
Characters with martial specialization gain points in Warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique.Once per any turn where you're capable of taking the attack action, you can make a simple attack as a free action, or as an additional simple attack if you do take the attack action.
Gain +2 to ACC and DR 5 vs disarm.Armors requires 2 less strength to use. You ignore the stealth penalty to heavy armor.Gain athletics as a skill with a +4 bonus. You can roll athletics to aid an ally as a swift action.
+4 to saves vs fear effects. The DC to demoralize you using intimidate is 4 higher.When combat starts, if you are below full hp, heal to full HP.
When an enemy is a minion, you automatically know just by looking at them. Gain an additional superior attack that can only be used against minion enemies. You are immune to being grazed by minions
Gain combat reflexes as a bonus feat. If you already have it, gain a bonus feat. You can use an attack of opportunity to swat a ranged attack out of the air that targets either you or an ally within reach. Roll an attack roll. If your attack roll matches or exceeds theirs, the attack is negated.
You take a -4 ACC penalty to attacks opposing siege weapons, such as cannons or giant rocks.Weapon attacks gain additional damage equal to their damage dice. Gain this again at level 10 Examples: 2h weapon @1=2d6, @6=4d6, @10=6d6 Light Weapon @1=d6, @6=2d6, @10=3d6As a standard action you can enchant weapons you hold with any quality from the magic weapons section. You can enchant 2 different weapons, and give them different enchants. You can enchant new weapons, but the old ones lose their enchantments.Weapons cannot have typically more than 1 enchantment, unless they have multiple enchantment slots.

item.title: Beast Trainer
item.description:
You form a close bond with a beast companion and mold your fighting style around fighting in tandem with it. You gain special abilities that allow you to establish a closer bond with them. Fighting individually you are fairly weak, but together you can unleash powerful combo attacks.Art by me!You have mixed specialization.
You gain 2 Technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after.
These technique points can be used on the shroomlette and pupper trees.
Characters with magical specialization gain points in academy equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips.
Characters with martial specialization gain points in Warfare equal to their highest tier of martial technique.
You gain the service of a specific animal to aid you on your journey. It grows more powerful as you do. More rules on beast companions in the Beast Companion section.
When you take the attack action, your beast companion can also use its attack action to attack the same creature. You both get +2 to ACC. This bonus also applies if you make an AoO against the same creature. This attack counts as one attack for the purposes of applying DR. Some forms of offensive actions that don't require an attack roll, such as maintaining a Grapple, can reasonably also grant this boon to the other member of the duo.When you use this feature and one strike is enough to defeat the creature, the other is consumed and you cannot use your companion's strike on another.All special attacks gained through this class deal an additional d6/odd LV dmg on hit if you and your beast companion both land an attack using tandem strike. You cannot combine these special attacks with other special attacks, even if your companion is the one performing the "special" part of the attack.
If one of your attacks is a Crit, then you crit this additional damage as well.Gain a teamwork feat. Your beast companion shares all of your teamwork feats.Select one of the following options that will shape your companion. Mount - Beast companion grows to size large. You can ride bareback (no saddle) without issue.
Guard - Companion gains the Bodyguard feat.
Watch - Companion gains the Ready for Anything feat.
Lucky - Companion gains +1 LUK
You learn the secret language, druidic (see Linguistics). In text form it can only be seen by other creatures that know druidic. You can essentially write secret messages by touching your finger to any natural object (typically boulders and trees) and writing. Any message written in this way can be erased by a creature that knows druidic with ease.As a standard action, you can touch your beast companion to transform it into a handheld action figure version of itself. As a standard action, you can toss it into an adjacent space to transform it back. If left in figurine form for too long, your companion will free itself when it gets hungry, thirsty or lonely.When traveling through natural terrain that restricts your movement, such as thick snow or dense jungle, you and your beast companion's speed are not affected. All allies that can see you or your beast companion also gain this benefit. After not seeing either of you for a few minutes, your allies lose this benefit.You can speak with your beast companion as though you shared a language. Other creatures cannot understand you unless they can speak with animals.
You can mana burn any amount to grant an equal number of adaptation points (from the adaptation points list) to your beast companion indefinitely. When you rest, this adaptation fades and you must reapply it.

item.title: Backstabber
item.description: +Achievement Requirement - Murder 3 people you once considered allies, or who at thought you were an ally (before you turned on them). If you murder someone in a position of great power, like a powerful guild leader or king, it counts as 3.Reward - You have a 6th sense for when people trust you. By observing how they react to your presence in a brief interaction (such as an introduction), you can tell whether they trust you, are indifferent towards you or if they distrust you.

item.title: Critical Pet
item.description: +Achievement Requirement - Use stealth to initiate combat on a creature by patting its head 3 times. This pat can have no mechanical effect such as delivering a spell or attacking.Reward - You unlock the "Pet" skill. It uses your stealth bonus. If you sneak up on a creature and pet their head (again, no additional mechanical effect), you establish dominance, giving you a +2 bonus to skills for the subsequent social or combat encounter. If a creature within reach is smaller than you, you can pet them as a free action 1/turn for no mechanical benefit (no save).

item.title: Battle Scars
item.description: +Achievement Requirement - Get defeated by a critical hit and survive in 3 different encounters. Or get crit 3 times in the same combat and survive.Reward - The scars you get from battle are deeply entrenched in your memory. Your memories of combats you have encountered cannot be magically removed. By touching them, you can perfectly recall past events, as long as they happened in the thick of combat. Other creatures can touch your scars to share in the experience of the memory

item.title: Progression Outside of Class
item.description:
Boons/Banes - Gained at level one as a result of having positive or negative luck.
Feats - Gained at level 1, and every odd level after.
Technique Points - Gain one that can be used on any school of techniques at level 2, and every even level after.
+Achievement - Can be gained at any time, even retroactively, when certain conditions are met, varying based on the achievement.

item.title: Character Creation
item.description: There are several things for you to decide when deciding what you're writing down on your character sheet. Start with a theme, aesthetic, fighting style, or a particular character type you want to mimic from popular media.These are in order of necessity for actually playing the game, but not necessarily in the order that is most convenient to any individual's workflow.

item.title: Archetype
item.description: A +Class Archetype is a specific branch of thematic abilities that are added to the original class. Unless otherwise stated, nothing is lost or replaced by selecting an Archetype.

item.title: Template, Innate Technique
item.description:
+Class Innate Technique
Action-Attack,
Standard Action,
Immediate Action,
Swift Action,
Free Action,
Instant Action,
At-Will
Recharge
LimitedDescription

item.title: Innate Technique
item.description:
Some Techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as when gained from Race, +Class, magic item, specialized training, or a boon granted by another creature. Not all Techniques gained in this way are innate - these are much more common on monsters.
Innate Techniques acquired by players do not take up Mana slots and are always prepared. Monsters usually have their natural abilities represented by Innate Techniques, and as such are usually made with an amount equal to their Mana.
Innate Techniques grant creatures the ability to use Techniques without the usual requirements. Spells do not require the Staff component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting. Concentration spells can still be ended with a Disarm +Combat Maneuver. Only one Concentration effect can be upkept in this way.Unless otherwise specified, you cannot re-prepare limited innate techniques to regain their use.
If a creature's innate constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a Swift Action.

item.title: Class and Weapon Abilities
item.description:
Class and Weapon abilities are not true Techniques, as they lack tiers (and thus do not scale with Upcast), and cannot be learned with Technique Points. They are very similar in function, however.
They are almost always Innate Techniques gained through your +Class, Feats, Magic Items, and wielding Weapons that have them.
Special Attacks also fall into this category. They are written separately for cataloguing and reference purposes.Weapon abilities often list compatibility, but these compatibilities are not immutable. Particularly powerful weapons may have seemingly incompatible abilities, to represent their unique position.
item.guid: Techniques/Class and Weapon Abilities/Class and Weapon Abilities.md

item.title: Will
item.description:
Will Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Will represents your mental resilience and ability to resist mental attacks such as Illusions, mind control, and Fear.
You add WIS and LV to your Will, as well as any bonuses from your +Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Will.md

item.title: Reflex
item.description:
Reflex Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Reflex represents your reactions and ability to evade or mitigate sudden attacks such as AoE.
You add DEX and LV to your Reflex, as well as any bonuses from your +Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Reflex.md

item.title: Fortitude
item.description:
Fortitude Saves are one of the three primary Saves Rolled to avoid a negative effect.
Your Fortitude represents your resistance to physical hardship, such as venom and concussive attacks.
You add STR and LV to your Fortitude, as well as any bonuses from your +Class.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/Fortitude.md

item.title: ACC
item.description:
Accuracy (ACC): What you add to your Attacks to beat a target's AC.
By default, you add your LV, DEX or STR depending on your weapon type, and bonuses from your +Class to your accuracy. Circumstance can also change acc.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/ACC.md

item.title: Orc
item.description: The race that's big, mean, and full of green.

item.title: Maneuver Adept
item.description:
Combat Feat
You get +4 ACC with Combat Maneuvers, and they can be used as a regular Attack instead of an Action-Attack. This means you can replace an AoO or other simple attack with a Combat Maneuver.

item.title: Weapon Qualities
item.description: Weapon Qualities describe what a Weapon does beyond its classification, Damage, and AS.

item.title: Dual-Wielding
item.description:
You can make attacks with weapons in both hands as long as they both have the light property. Whenever you make an attack against a creature (unless +Combat Maneuver) with one of your weapons (the "main hand"), you can make an additional simple attack (that cannot be replaced with any other type of attack) against the same creature with the other weapon (the "off hand") .Because you strike with the 2 weapons in tandem, if the "main hand" attack is enough to defeat a creature, you cannot make an "off hand" attack against a different creature.
If you make a special attack that involves making multiple attacks, such as the Cleave special attack, you can only make the "off hand" attack against the first creature you attack with it. If the special attack grants some special property to the weapon, like weapon toss allowing you to throw any weapon, it does not do so for the off-hand unless specified otherwise.If you gain additional limbs to wield weapons, you do not get more "main hand" or "off hand" attacks by default.You cannot dual wield with natural attacks or unarmed strikes by default.

item.title: Poise
item.description:
+Combat Maneuvers are forms of attack that do not directly deal damage and are dependent on a stat called poise. Poise determines how difficult you are to toss around. It functions similarly to hp, but you subtract the attack roll from the target's poise. If this reduces them to 0 poise, they suffer the effects of the maneuver and their poise resets to maximum. Poise naturally resets after combat ends or by taking the total defense action. Other effects that toss characters around might also interact with poise. If poise is reduced via lowered stats without a combat maneuver being used, it drops to a minimum of 1 (unless otherwise specified).Using a combat maneuver replaces melee attacks by default.Poise is calculated as follows. Common things like armor, shields and feats add to poise. All bonuses to poise stack.10 + (level) + (strength) + (dexterity) + (armor/shields) + (class) + (etc)Any damage reduction also applies to poise damage.
Combat maneuvers by default have the Martial tag, allowing you to use the attack, damage and bonus effects of a held weapon or natural attack, even if it states you use another attack form.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Poise.md

item.title: Full Attacker
item.description:
Fighter Archetype.Feeling nostalgic about 3e, 3.5e or PF1e? Well here's me doing my best to recreate that experience in a slightly less heavy handed way than BB fighter. The full attacker is the fightiest guy, all about gaining insane amounts of movement speed and then using that speed to gain more actions. Woe to those who dare to stand in your face.If you defeat an enemy and don't have enough speed to reach a new enemy, you can move until you threaten the next closest enemy, unless your speed is 0.Any turn you spend your standard action to make an attack, can make an additional MELEE superior attack a turn by sacrificing 45 speed once per turn.You cannot use techniques or special attacks after full attacking. If you use a special attack or technique during your turn, you cannot full attack.During combat, your speed increases by 15 this level and another 5 every level after. You must always end your movement with an enemy in reach. If you ever end your turn without an enemy in reach for any reason, you become clumsy 1.Each one can be used in place of a superior attack and they all share a global cooldown, only able to be used 1/round. You cannot sacrifice superior attacks gained from baby slayer to use these abilities.
5 Steps Ahead (elusive) - Prepare for an incoming attack. While preparing you can trigger this ability as an immediate action, moving up to 30 feet to the opposite side of a creature that affects you with a harmful effect. You get a +4 bonus to AC and saves against this effect.
Random Bullshit Go - Throw an item that isn't a weapon. Improvised weapons can still be used. If you throw a harmful item, such as a toxin, it applies on hit (then forcing saving throws as normal). If you throw a helpful item, such as a potion, its effects function as normal, ignoring any broken vials that may get involved. If for whatever reason an effect requires multiple rounds to take effect, that is still the case for this ability.
Cunning-ish Action - You can disengage, jump, aid, focus or make a +Combat Maneuver. Brute Force - Roll an athletics check to move or break something.When you full attack, you can sacrifice an additional 45 speed to make an additional attack with the same restrictions.

item.title: Advantage
item.description: There are many abilities in the game that allow you additional odds success in some limited capacity. These are usually represented through rerolls and advantage.Rerolls do as they might suggest; they allow you to roll dice again after you didn't like the result. Whenever you use a reroll on a dice roll that you have advantage or disadvantage on, you make that reroll with advantage or disadvantage.Advantage allows you to roll 2 dice and take the desired of the 2 results. Inversely, disadvantage forces you to roll 2 dice and take the lower of the 2 results. Multiple instances of advantage allow you to roll the dice more, 3, 4, maybe even 5 times and take the desired result. Advantage and disadvantage cancel each other out.If that’s confusing, treat advantage as +1 and disadvantage as -1 in the chart below.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Advantage.md

item.title: Frightened
item.description: Creature cannot move closer to the source of its fear. It has disadvantage on attacks and opposed skill checks against the source of its fear.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Frightened.md

item.title: Grapple
item.description: Your foe is entangled and Held Down. Your speed is reduced to zero and you pull the creature adjacent to you. The creature cannot Threaten. Each round you can spend your standard action to keep the target in place and make an attack (but not a multiattack) against them with a melee attack, requiring no roll.If you are moved out of reach from the target, have your poise reduced to zero, or are otherwise unable to maintain your grip, the target is freed.Special: Multiple creatures can grapple one creature. The bonus to attack against a target that is entangled from a grapple increases by 2 per additional creature. Special: You must use at least one prehensile limb to initiate and maintain a grapple on a creature, unless your weapon has the CM Grapple property. Special: Creatures ignore the attack penalty from partial and total concealment against creatures that they are being grappled by or are grappling.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Attacking/Combat Maneuvers/Grapple.md

item.title: Held Down
item.description:
Creature cannot stand up and is persistently Knocked Down
A creature who is Grappled is automatically also Held Down
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Held Down.md

item.title: Glowing
item.description:
Creature emits Bright Light with a 5 Ft Radius, causing it to suffer -20 Stealth. Creatures attacking a glowing creature get a +2 bonus to ACC.
The acc boost does not stack with Ablaze.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Glowing.md

item.title: Alchemist
item.description:
Alchemist is a hybrid class with the potential to branch in many directions depending on the desired play style. Using the power of SCIENCE you can create friends, enhance your friends, yourself or you can manipulate the world around you in a variety of creative ways.You have magical specialization You gain 2 technique points at level 1, then another point every 2 levels after. These technique points can be used alchemy tree.Characters with magical specialization gain points in wild card equal to their highest tier of magic technique and cantrips.You get the alchemy skill for free and a +4 bonus to alchemy checks.
The Save DC of the items you create, even ones without alchemical inspiration, increase to your save DC if it is higher.Using a pouch of nebulous materials and strange liquids, you can make and administer, activate or throw an alchemical item as a standard action.
You can use this feature with items that have a craft DC of 10+your alchemy bonus automatically. Anything higher requires a roll. Failures consume materials, expending a daily use.You can create (3+Lv) items for free each day, but such items must be used immediately the turn they are created or they lose their potency.When you drink from a jizzle, it also gives you 10 temp hp.Every alchemist is defined by their (often nonsensical) specialization. In order to make you, the player, feel like you are on the cutting edge of research, you can break the usual rules of the game and create entirely new class features with a specific focus. This can include things like researching how to gain additional limbs or genetically engineered catgirls.More details in the "Major Fields of Study" section.Upgrade! Abilities granted by your major are improved, loosening the restrictions.Abilities granted by your major are perfected, eliminating all but the most extreme restrictions.

item.title: +Class
item.description:
Classes are the fundamental basis from which you obtain abilities.Classes get a set of numerical bonuses to aid them. Every class has listed +HP, Skills, Memory, and at least one Save bonus. Stats can be flat front-loaded amounts, per-LV bonuses, or both.
Most characters will get their core abilities front-loaded at level 1. All classes get access to some type of Techniques, which can be martial techniques or spells. Technique points granted through class usually have some form of restriction.Even levels are mostly dedicated to class features that directly increase the classes power. This includes gaining access to new combat abilities, increasing the power of old ones, and getting their own special attacks.
Odd levels are mostly dedicated to getting the next tier of techniques. As such, class features are usually sparse. If any are included, they are usually minor increases in power or they are flavorful inclusions. You also get a Feat every odd level.
Most classes require selecting an Archetype at level 1, which grants more specific thematic abilities.

item.description:
Tier 2 Lunar Spell
Standard Action, Limited
TransmutationThis spell must be cast in the presence of moonlight.You fall asleep, your body lifted into the air on a cloud of stardust.
Every minute, you regain 1 +HP. After 30 minutes, you are restored to full HP. You also gain a new save vs any Poison and non-Curse spell effects. This counts as a Short Rest, but you cannot eat to gain the benefits of Food.You are otherwise asleep as normal, and anything that would normally wake you up still can. This ends the spell early, denying its full effect.

Tier 1 Warfare Technique

Healing
You very briefly tend to yourself and focus, giving yourself half your +HP in Temporary HP, up to your total missing HP. This Provokes until the start of your next turn.If used on an ally, you both must take the action, and you both Provoke.
This bonus HP lasts until you roll Initiative again.

Passive, Immediate Action, Recharge]]

Upcast 1 - The threshold increases by 5.

item.description:
Classes/Fighter/Fighter Innate Technique
Standard Action, Limited
Buff
and Passive
You get a +4 bonus to Fortitude. Your +HP increases by 6+4/LV.
As a Standard Action, grant 3+CHA allies an additional 4/LV +HP. This is based on their level.
This bonus ends when they Long Rest, or you are Defeated.

item.title: Monster Lore
item.description:
Adventurers are assumed to know basic things about monsters, like how a Construct's lack of anatomy grants them resistance to many effects, or the properties of Incorporeal creatures. Monster Lore checks are for figuring out more information about specific monster types, or if a creature is hiding its typing.Monster stat blocks are broken up into sections. Basic stats (Saves, +HP and AC), offense traits (breath weapons, dangerous auras, prominent spells), defense traits (healing abilities, elemental Resistances), other traits (extra senses, extra movement options, out of combat abilities) and weaknesses/deep lore (lich's phylactery, vampires not appearing in mirrors).
Rolling a Monster Lore check is something you can do as a Free Action once per turn. It is assumed that you also vocalize what you learn to your team. The base DC of a Monster Lore check is (10+creature's LV). By succeeding on a Monster Lore check, you can figure out a creature's basic stats and one other category for your choice. For every 5 over the DC you roll, you figure out another category. If a creature has nothing in a category, you choose another.
Creatures with the [unique] tag in their entry increase their Monster Lore DC by 5. Humanoids with class levels by default are assumed to have the [unique] tag, unless their class comes with clearly distinguishable features (such as a Classes/Fighter/Archetypes/Dark Knight's Evil Eye), or they are part of an organization with similar training and abilities (such as a Monk dojo or city guards).

item.title: Dwarf
item.description: The most relatable Race.

item.title: Endurance
item.description:
Combat Feat
Requirement: +1 STR
The first time you would be Defeated or outright killed in a day, you are instead not Defeated. If it was a result of taking damage, your +HP is set to 1.
Whenever you are Defeated, you can make a single attack immediately before you are Defeated.
You automatically pass the STR Roll when Recovering from Defeat.

item.title: Food
item.description:
Food is one of the most common and necessary consumable resources to survive difficult journeys and dangerous dungeons. It is the slower, more efficient alternative to potions, which may grant their benefits briefly or in smaller amounts at a moment's notice.It is assumed all food items are portioned properly as a meal, and cooked to preserve. They never spoil as long as they are handled properly and are not damaged directly, such as by fire. Raw ingredients will spoil unless cooked.Food is consumed during a Short Rest over 15 minutes, unless otherwise stated.
Food primarily restores +HP, but may grant bonus effects until you eat again or Long Rest.The value of a particular food increases with how much it heals/what it grants and how little it weighs.
The creation of food requires edible organic materials, time, and skill. See Cooking for more.The following are some basic examples of food:

item.title: Necrosed
item.description: Healing effects that restore +HP or grant Temp HP are half as effective (minimum 1 healing).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Necrosed.md

item.title: Invincible
item.description: Creature's +HP cannot be reduced.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Invincible.md

item.title: Drained
item.description: A stacking condition that decreases all Rolls by 1. Lowers your current and maximum +HP by 5 each stack. One stack is removed when Resting for a week straight.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Drained.md

item.title: Temp HP
item.description: Temporary Hitpoints (Temp HP) are gained separately from your +HP. They are lost before your HP, and multiple sources do not stack - only the highest applies.Unless otherwise stated, Temp HP only lasts 1 minute.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Temp HP.md

item.title: Recovering from Defeat
item.description:
After being Defeated for an hour after the last time it took damage, a creature may attempt to shake off the condition with a STR Roll. On a 10 or higher, they lose the Defeated condition, but as long as their +HP remains negative, they are Staggered. On a fail, they lose 5 HP.
After successfully recovering, the creature is Drained by d4-LUK. This drain cannot kill the creature.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Hitpoints/Recovering from Defeat.md

item.title: Healing
item.description: Healing is an effect that restores current +HP up to your maximum HP, grants Temp HP, or removes debilitating status conditions.

item.title: Damage
item.description:
Damage is a value that subtracts from a target's +HP or Poise when the effect takes place.
Damage is always assigned a type. The physical damage types are Crush, Slash, and Pierce, and the elemental types are Force, Lightning, Fire, Cold, Holy, Necrotic, Poison and Psychic. These are also Tags. Poise damage is its own separate thing.If something deals multiple damage types, it usually adds both tags to the effect. For example, a flaming sword will deal Fire and Slash damage with its total damage, rather than separate d6 slash and d4 fire.When attacking with a weapon, natural attack or unarmed strike,

item.title: Beast Companion
item.description: Beast companions are primarily for the beast tamer class, but the rules can be adjusted for use in other classes, as well as the pet feat.Your animal companion understands one language of your choosing (usually common). Its size is small or medium. For ease of play reasons, it is assumed that your beast companion generally does as you wish and you are allowed to control all of its actions in combat, though it does still have a will of its own.All companions have the following set of ability scores and armor, chosen on character creation. Add dex to this armor value.All companions have the following traits...

item.description: Garden Skeleton, LV 0 UndeadAttacks Garden Skeletons are found with a variety of basic or improvised weaponry - more often improvised melee weapons.AbilitiesOther Traits

item.title: Ifrit
item.description: Ifrit, LV 3 ElementalAttacks An Ifrit uses superheated slams that can strike multiple enemies at once.AbilitiesOther Traits A

item.title: LUK
item.description:
Luck (LUK): Your ability to turn tides and benefit from unlikely outcomes. You get a boon for every point of luck you have
You add LUK to Luck Checks.
You can add LUK to a Roll as an Immediate Action (that did not already add LUK). You must roll to add luck, so you cannot add it when you take 10 (such as when using skills for income) or take 20 Negative LUK give you a bane per point of negative luck
Your DC decreases by your negative luck Subtracted from luck checks
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/LUK.md

item.title: WIS
item.description:
Wisdom (WIS): Your faith, decision making, habits, diligence, and discipline. You add WIS to your Will Save.
You add your wisdom to perception, the skill all creatures get for free You can pray to your god for guidance (see below for details). You can use prayer a number of times per day equal to your wisdom bonus Positive wisdom automatically puts you into T1 favor in one god. 1k GBP per point Characters with positive wisdom multiply GBP gains by (1+wis) Negative WIS subtracts from these value Negative wisdom represents a complete lack of faith in most gods or being rejected by them, you cannot gain GBP (unless in service of Frogg Saran)
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/WIS.md

item.title: Prayer
item.description: You get a number of uses of prayer equal to (WIS+tier of favor). Because positive wisdom grants T1 favor in a god, you usually start with (WIS+1) uses of prayer, or 0 if you have no wisdom.The default use of prayer is praying. Praying requires 1 minute of uninterrupted concentration.You gain impressions from the future about something in specific. When you initially start praying, you must mention a specific action (attack the bandits, pet the dog etc.). When the prayer is complete, gain a nugget information about whether this action will bring favorable or unfavorable results to you within the next half hour. The answer does not take into account consequences into the future past 30 minutes.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/Prayer.md

item.title: STR
item.description:
Strength (STR): Your fortitude, athleticism, and endurance. You add STR to your Fortitude Save.
You add STR to your Poise
You add +100 Carry Weight for each point of strength
Every point of strength increases your Jump distance by 5 ft. Negative STR subtracts from your Fortitude Saves. Negative STR halves your Carry Weight.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/STR.md

item.title: +Saving Throw
item.description:
Saving Throws (Saves) are Rolls decide the effectiveness of abilities or effects that do not require an Attack. It is typically the affected creature that rolls the save. In order to consider a saving throw a pass, the affected creature must match or roll higher than the DC of the effect.
The DC of a Saving Throw is usually 12 plus the Level of the effect.
Saves come in 3 forms: Fortitude saves (based on STR), Reflex saves (based on DEX), and Will saves (based on WIS).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Saving Throws/+Saving Throw.md

item.title: Rainbow Beam
item.description:
Tier 4 Prismancy Spell
Action-Attack, Limited
Fire, Light, Buff
Evocation
Line attack deals 6 SP+CL Fire Damage to enemies, but instead of harming allies, it grants them a Lucky Rainbow - visible as an aura around them. They may consume this rainbow to reroll any one Attack, Save, or Skill Check within a minute, after which it disappears.
Glowing enemies become Sickened 2.
Upcast 1 - +1 SP Damage.

item.title: Solar Flash
item.description:
Tier 2 Prismancy Spell
Standard Action, Recharge
Fire, Light
Evocation
All sighted creatures (minus self) must make a Reflex Save or take CL Fire Damage and be Blinded for one round. Resisting the damage does not negate the Blinded effect.

item.title: Illumination
item.description:
Tier 1 Prismancy Spell
Passive
Light, Fire
Evocation
Whenever you use a Light spell to hit a creature with an Attack, or they fail a Save against it, they begin Glowing for 1 round.
When you apply Glowing to an enemy, you or an ally can Attack the target to end the condition immediately and deal an additional SP Fire Damage.

item.title: Fascinated
item.description: Creature cannot take actions other than watch the source of its fascination. Creature loses this condition after it is attacked, has a +Saving Throw inflicted on it, or succeeds on a Perception check to notice a creature in its pockets or otherwise taking an offensive action. If the source of its fascination is no longer visible (or able to be sensed for other types of fascination), the condition also ends. After this happens, the creature temporarily becomes immune to fascination for 1 minute.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Status Effects/Fascinated.md

item.title: Weakness
item.description:
Having weakness means you take more damage from a specifc Damage type. It is expressed in numerical values like "Holy 3." Denoting that if an attack does holy damage, after all damage calculation, it deals 3 more.
Creatures can also have a weakness to something that isnt damage. They have a -4 penalty to Saves against effects of a certain Tag.

item.title: Total Defense
item.description: Get +2 to AC and Saves until the start of your next turn. Remove all Clumsy stacks and reset your poise. You can't make an AoO while using Total Defense.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Total Defense.md

item.title: Aid
item.description:
Provide one of the following bonuses to an ally within your reach for 1 round:+2 to ACC
+2 to Saves
+2 to AC
Alternatively, remove one stack of the following conditions: Clumsy, Shaken, Sickened, or Knocked Down.
Note: Many Entangled effects can be removed using Athletics. Use the Aid action to assist an ally in overcoming these conditions.You can aid a defeated creature when not in combat, bringing them to 1 hp. Extreme circumstances may require more assistance to restore a creature particularly out of it (such as medicine or magic).
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Actions/Common Actions/Standard Actions/Aid.md

item.title: Lv
item.description: Level (LV): the level assigned to a creature or effect is used to represent their relative strength in the setting. Level is added to all Rolls (Attacks, +Saving Throws, proficient Skills, etc.)
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/Lv.md

item.title: DC
item.description: Difficulty Class (DC) is the target number that a Roll must reach to be considered a success.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Abbreviations and Terminology/DC.md

item.title: INT
item.description:
Intelligence (INT): Your knowledge, magical expertise, and logic capacity. You gain an additional point of Memory per point of INT
You gain an additional Skill Proficiency per point of INT
You gain two additional Languages per point of INT (listed in the Skills section under
Linguistics)
You gain a Mana reserve for each point in intelligence Negative int subtracts from these values. In particular, you lose max mana equal to your negative int. Intelligence and Sentience A creature is considered sentient if it has at least -2 intelligence. These creatures typically do not speak, but can understand at least 1 language.Animal intelligence is -3 intelligence. Creatures with animal intelligence only understand simple commands (if anything). They are usually limited to their instinctual urges.Mindless creatures possess no will of their own. They act completely on instinct.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/INT.md

item.title: DEX
item.description:
Dexterity (DEX): Your agility, hand-eye coordination, and general sneakiness. You add DEX to your Reflex Save.
Depending on your choice in armor, you can add your dexterity to your AC, but you always add it to Poise
You add dexterity to ACC and Damage with ranged weapons and light weapons (but not at the same time as strength)
Every point of DEX adds +5 to your Speed Negative DEX subtracts from these values.
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/DEX.md

item.title: CHA
item.description:
Charisma (CHA): Your leadership and personal magnetism. Positive charisma enhances your Companion creatures. Any creature that takes a companion slot gains your CHA to their Accuracy
With positive charisma, you get a teamwork feat For every point of CHA, you can grant another creature one of your teamwork feats. To do this, you must spend 1 hour doing training exercises with the creatures you intend to team up with You lose a companion slot with negative CHA. Negative CHA reduces your companion's Accuracy You cannot benefit from teamwork feats with negative charisma
item.guid: Core Rules, How to Play/Ability Scores/CHA.md

item.title: Purifier
item.description:
You fix and heal, but not in the traditional sense. Your area of expertise is in reversing the irreversible. It is not all too uncommon to find individuals who are victims of a forced reincarnation from frogg saran or that are being changed by some kind of alien mutation or profane corruption. You aim to turn back time to where the creature was healthy whole and themselves again...eventually.Using alchemical inspiration, 100g of materials and 1 minute of time... You can fashion a prosthetic limb or organ fitted to a specific creature's needs. When inserted or attached, the organ assumes normal functionality, albeit with some getting used to. Limbs inflict clumsy 1 and organs inflict sickened 1. These debuffs cannot be removed and persist for 1 week. At the end of the week, the limbs are indistinguishable from the originals, leaving only connecting scar tissue.
You can also create a foil to the effects of a styx potion, or other effects that remove memories or sense of self. A year comes back to them for each day that follows them drinking your memory potion. Anything reasonably close to these abilities in terms of power/effect Using alchemical inspiration, a laboratory, 1,000g of materials and 1 minute of time... Limbs/organs you replace do not apply debuffs
You can reverse the effects of a reincarnation spell, returning the creature to its previous form. If a creature is corrupted but not yet completely consumed by some malicious force, such as a creature part way through transforming into a fiend, you can reverse the direction of this corruption. Over time after administering your solution, the creature reverts back to its old self, assuming it does not continue to actively corrupt further. Anything reasonably close to these abilities in terms of power/effect What counts as "corruption" is intentionally left vague, because alchemists are supposed to break rules, not be bound by them. In fantasy, any number of things can "corrupt" for greater power or as a consequence of associating with evil. You can counter the GM bullshit if you manage to capture corrupted allies or save otherwise unwilling enemies.Using alchemical inspiration, a laboratory, 1 rare materials and 1 minute of time you can restore a creature back from anything short of death.A rare material is again, intentionally vague, because its not an item that exists in the game, but is something that should exist in the world. These ingredients should be extracted from creatures that have incredible restorative properties, are immortal or something similar.
A phoenix feather
A shard from an ancient monolith
Blood from a Celestial or a powerful troll

item.title: beast-totem
item.description:
Embrace your wild side. Beast totem barbarians tend to be furrier and feathery-er than most.You gain the beast trainer's beast companion class feature. You are limited to choosing the stronk type companion. Your companion starts off with 2 adaptation points, and gains no more as it levels. Its level is your level-1. (yes you can be level 0)Numbers are level requirementsYou and your beast companion gain an additional 40 speed each round that can only be used to climb or swim. As a swift action, you can sprout wings to gain the glide feature for 1 round.
You get knowledge nature proficiency with a +4 bonus. You can use it while raging. You also know druidic.Gain blindsense (scent, 10 ft). You and your beast companion gain seeking against any creature that does not have full hp.
Choose a specific animal you can transform into and back from as a swift action. Gain a single natural attack that deals 2d6 damage and 3 points worth of abilities from the shapeshifter's shapeshift class feature that only apply when in spirit animal form. Once chosen, these features cannot be altered.Your appearance is slightly unnatural for the type of creature you transform into, typically being larger and more dangerous looking with glowing eyes or strange fur patterns.Your companion can also transform into this form as an instant action when you do.You can speak with beasts as though you shared a common language. They are able to much better articulate their feelings as though they possessed the intellect of a simple humanoid, but their instincts, desires and attitude toward you remain largely the same.When your beast companion successfully performs a drag maneuver, it gains an additional 30 speed. It must be able to end this movement with the drag target in a space you threaten if it uses this bonus speed.Whenever you rage, your beast companion can rage as an instant action, gaining the benefits of your rage.

item.title: the-boss
item.description:
Being the boss is all about getting into the middle of the fight, taking and dealing blows and equal measure and using their enemies as their weapons.Flurry does not suffer a MA penalty. Only applies to one flurry attack.While below half hp, gain FH 1 and access to haymaker.Special Attack: Haymaker (Su) [force] [healing] [recharge] Gain (10+2*lvl) as temp hp until the start of next turn. Deal the same value in force damage in a 30-foot cone (reflex halves). You can also make a melee attack against a creature to have the cone erupt from them. On-hit the creature takes a -2 penalty to their save against haymaker. Can only be used 1/minute.Whenever you provoke an AoO, get a +2 bonus to attack until the end of your turn.If you land an unarmed attack or break poise against two creatures that are within reach, you slam them together, stunning them for 1 turn (fort negates). If you are already grappling a creature, you only need to land an attack or poise break 1 other creature within reach. If you are grappling two creatures, this happens automatically. Once a creature is stunned by this ability (or negates the stun), it is immune for 1 hour.When grappling a creature, you can cause the grappled creature to be the target of an attack roll instead of you as an immediate action.You know the barbarism technique Foe Toss and automatically memorize it without consuming memory.
You know the magical technique Command and automatically memorize it without consuming memory. You can use it without a staff.Perform an unarmed strike and uppercut your foe into the stratosphere (fort negates). While airborne, the target is considered thousands of feet away from the battlefield and is entangled. At the end of your next turn they land in the space they were launched from, taking 20 crush damage from falling and are knocked down.If the attack defeats the foe, they are instead launched d100 miles in a random direction.
You gain the wrestling move of the same name (see wrestling moves for more details). It can also be a finisher. The initial target and creatures in the impact zone instead take 7d6+lvl (24+lvl) crush damage and are staggered for 1 round (fort halves damage and negates stagger).Can only be used 1/minute.

item.title: Half-Link
item.description: The umbrella Race for all animal-humanoid races. Every Half-Link lineage has a distinct and rich culture and history, but every possible iteration is not represented. This version represents the most common, culturally fragmented sets of lineages not otherwise represented.

item.title: runescape-skills
item.description:
For clarity's sake... Everything written in Green is a skill. Everything written in Red is a combat talent you can unlock under that skill. Everything written in Purple is a utility talent you can unlock under that skill. Abilities that are preceded by a number have a level requirement.Prayer (Knowledge Religion)Protection Prayers (Su) - Gain an additional point of prayer. When you would harmed by an attack or fail a saving throw, you can choose to negate the attack or pass the save by spending prayer as an immediate action. Piety (Su) - Gain an additional point of prayer. By spending prayer as a swift action, you can give yourself a +2 bonus to all d20 rolls until the start of your next turn.Magic (Knowledge Arcana)Magical Specialization - Gain magical specialization, giving you access to 6 cantrips and points in wildcard equal to your highest level magical technique. (6) Magic! - Gain access to the telekinetic lift and alchemize techniques as 1/day innate techniques.
(5) Antimagic - Gain access to the teleblock and superstitious techniques as 1/day innate techniques.Herblore (Knowledge Alchemy)
Quick Brewski - You can craft an alchemical item for 10% of its original price with 1 hour of work 1/day. You must still be able to meet its craft DC. You must still be able to provide odd specific ingredients, such as the tongue in a tongues potion. (5) Chug - You can drink a potion once per turn as a free action. When you drink a health potion or a mana potion, you subtract the amount of mana burn and drain you gain by 1.Fishing (Profession Fisher)Reel 'em In - You can use a fishing rod to finely manipulate objects. You can manipulate anything you could normally carry, replacing any sleight of hand check with profession (fisher). Range 30 ft Patience - You get a +2 bonus to attack when you attack as part of a prepared action. (4) Fish are Friends (Su) - Using the power of fishing, you can convert aquatic creatures into friends. By catching a specific type of fish with a DC 30 profession (fisher) check, you can get a bonus to an +2 associated skill check when using the fish as a tool, as though they successfully used the assist other action. Unique fish might be able to assist in other ways, this is meant to apply to anything, within reason. This fish transcends its fishy existence to survive outside of water to assist you. It cannot be attacked, but it can be stolen. This kills the fish. A few examples of weird fish upgrades below…Hammerhead - Smithing, construction, you name it Pufferfish (or other poisonous) - For use in creating poisons Monkfish - Good for meditation Archerfish - You can trip with your ranged attacks Sharks - Underwater tracking Bass - Good for dropping sick beats Seahorse - Makes for a good underwater mountWoodcutting (Profession Lumberjack)
One With Nature (Sp) - You gain Tree Shape as an at will innate technique. You can speak with plants. Axe Man - You gain a climb speed equal to your land speed. If you wield an axe, this speed doubles. Treebane - While wielding an axe, you can make a profession (lumberjack) check to cut down a tree within your reach without even swinging at it as a standard action. DC 10 for medium sized trees, then 10 higher per size above medium. Sentient trees are immune to treebane. Whenever you use profession (lumberjack) to make money, you essentially take 20 instead of 15, increasing your bonus by 10.Cooking (Profession Chef)Amazing Food [healing] - Turn mundane food into AMAZING FOOD. It takes you 1 hour of work and 100g of supplies to cook 5 pieces. They heal 10% hp when eaten on as a swift action, or double that if "savored" as a standard action. If he makes more food, the pieces of food made previously perish, but they otherwise remain fresh forever. Tick Eating [healing] - When you take hit point damage that would defeat you, you can eat a piece of AMAZING FOOD as an immediate action, causing you to instead be set to 10% hp. Feast [healing] - Mining (Profession Miner)Shaft Mining - As a standard action, you can mine a 5x5x5 ft cube, effectively allowing you to burrow underground. You can only use this ability on unworked stone/earth etc. You must wield a pickaxe to do so. Whenever you use profession (miner) to make money, you essentially take 20 instead of 15, increasing your bonus by 10. Break In - You can use profession miner as a substitute for athletics to break things as long as you wield a pickaxe. You get a +4 bonus to do so. (8) Vibrations (Su) - As a standard action, you can slam a pickaxe into the ground to gain blindsense (tremorsense 30 ft) for 1 round. This allows you to see the general shape of things like buildings and caves, even through walls and floors.Construction (Knowledge Engineering)Bridge the Gap (Su) - While you wield a hammer, you have a “bridge speed” equal to your speed that lets you quickly nail together planks and walk along them. This bridge is solid enough for creatures to walk on and lasts until the end of your turn, or the start of your turn if you want your allies to follow. Costs 2g per foot bridged (30ft=60g). You can continue the bridge indefinitely, even as previous sections fall, effectively ignoring gravity, but you must at least start attached to something. Affordable Housing - With an hour of work, you can build a makeshift house with natural materials like dirt, wood and stone. You can remove T1 afflictions with general cures by resting in such a house. (3) Comfort - By creating a home worth at least 2k gold, you can get a boost by resting in this home. You and any allies get temp HP equal to half your skill roll. By spending the gold again, you can make home improvements to improve roll again to gain more temp hp.Hunter (Survival)
Speak to Me (Su) - You gain the wild empathy feat. You can speak with animals. (3) Box Trap - With 10 minutes of preparation you can set a box trap for a specific creature, or a type of creature. You leave a trail of desirable substances to a box with a stick propping it up. The creature makes a perception check (DC 15+your survival bonus). If they succeed then they notice the unusual and untrustworthy setup. If they fail they are trapped in the box for one minute. Creatures with more than -2 int get advantage on their perception check, and can escape the box using any means at their disposal. Athletics DC to break is equal to the perception check to notice.Agility (Acrobatics)Boost - You can dash as a swift action. You can dash as a free action, but it makes you fatigued. Endurance Training - +10 speed. Parkour - You can jump as a free action 1/turn. When you jump, you ignore fall damage from 60 ft of falling. When you take fall damage, you take 1 damage per 10 ft you fall. (4) Shortcut (Su) - You can squeeze through the tightest of spaces and the smallest of cracks. Even with only a centimeter of space, you can slide through it. You can even comfortably sit in spaces like these indefinitely. You can't effectively navigate while squished in this way, making it only usable to get through very thin surfaces with gaps, like doors and windows.Fire Making (Profession Arson)Fireproof - You gain resistance to fire damage. You take no damage or penalty to AC while ablaze. You can snap your fingers to spontaneously combust as a free action. The fire is cosmetic and provides light, but no heat.
Meltation - You gain the Melt firebending style ability. If you don't have the elemental blast feature, your blast damage is (d6+d6/odd lvl).
Pyrotechnics - You gain a technique point in the pyromancy tree. You can select this boon multiple times. Dubstep Ignite [recharge] - When a creature survives one of your attacks with 5 or less hp, you know. You can spend an instant action to deal 5 true damage to them. Usable 1/minute.
(5) Solves Everything (Sp) - You gain fireblast as a 1/day innate technique. You increase its range to 120 ft. At level 9 this is usable at will.

item.title: Alchemist Majors
item.description: Making your own class features can be tough, both maintaining balance and a cohesive theme. This section should help provide guidelines for not only the types of things you should be thinking about studying for your alchemist, but also the power of the mechanical effects.In general, majors can be separated into a few categories.The main thing that you should be focusing on for your major is thinking about a completely unique thing that your character specializes in. It should be specific and limited in scope.Idea Phase: "I specialize in transforming into animals" is a bit too vague and is too similar to the shapeshifter class. If we are on the cutting edge of new techniques, we want something that isn't just another class's features."I specialize in grafting beast parts to people" is more specific, and falls more closely in line with what you imagine a fantasy scientist would do. For me at least, it's easy to imagine Frankenstein's monster type alchemist that has slowly replaced his body with more optimal animal parts to become a completely unique creature.Mechanics Phase: Sticking with the idea of grafting animal parts, this idea lends itself well to an enhancer type play style. You might gather the parts during your adventures by purchasing them or killing the beasts yourself, but gaining benefits requires work you do ahead of time.Crafting rules are elsewhere, where you can find how long it takes, how much it cost and how difficult it should be. Right now we are concerned with the mechanics. What should a grafted part do? Considering you are fusing parts onto yourself you could give yourself noteworthy parts from other animals to gain permanent abilities: Dog nose for scent, bull horns for a natural attack, fins and gills for aquatic adventures. Considering you're replacing your humanoid parts, there might also be some drawbacks. Lion claws aren't the best for grasping things like opposable thumbs are, for example.An ability like this can open up opportunities for limitless power as long as you keep pouring resources into it, so it should also have some hard limitation. Limiting yourself to only mixing and matching 3 parts for example. Considering the mechanical effect is similar, perhaps use shapeshifter's point system as a basis for how powerful the individual parts can be.Thesis marks the point where few have developed their research to this point. This should be the point where you start bending rules and creating increasingly ridiculous items with your craft.Continuing with the idea of grafting animal parts, this is where you might add a second tier to your crafting. No longer are you just replacing parts, but you can add completely new ones, doing things like turning people into centaurs of all kinds of creatures, giving yourself an additional limb, maybe an extra beast head.Up the limit of how many parts you can give a creature, so long as they are willing to accept tier 2 augmentations.Grand discovery marks the point where only the best, brightest and most insane push their research to the boundaries of what should be possible. This is the point where you should be breaking rules and doing things once only thought imaginary.By combining different animal parts from dead creatures, you can create entirely new creatures. You can make alterations to yourself to make you completely unrecognizable from when you began. Once upon a time you were a man. Now you are a massive spider from the waist down allowing you to climb any surface with ease, your torso is covered in thick chitin to protect your vitals, your head is covered in beady eyes to allow you to see in all directions.

item.title: boomkin
item.description: You have created a fragile companion meant to run in, tank some hits, and go out in a blaze of glory. Use beast tamer's beast companion as a baseline for what your creature should be with the following changes… >It can be a plant, ooze, humanoid, fey, magical beast or monstrous humanoid. >It gains 2 initial adaptation points and gains none from leveling. >It has half its usual hp. >It's intelligence is -2 and it can speak a language of your choosing, but not very well >It loses the evasion, scent, lost companions and one liner features of beast companionIt gains the following special ability... Kaboom [fire] - Using your standard action, or when it is defeated, your creation explodes violently. Deals (10+3*lvl) fire damage in a 10 ft radius to ALL creatures (reflex halves).>You have evasion vs your creation's explosions (auto take half dmg, save for no effect). >You can recreate your companion by spending 1 minute and 1 alchemical inspiration, good as new. It maintains its memories and harbors no ill will towards you for its repeated destruction.You grow accustomed to your research blowing up into your face. You make it blow up in new ways, adding more variety. When your creation explodes, you can choose one of the following explosion types. Earthshatter [earth] - Damage changes to crush. Groundborne creatures that save are knocked down (reflex negates) Inferno [fire] - AoE increases to 20 ft radius Cold Snap [frost] - Damage changes to cold.
